basics.name: Jake Taranov
basics.summary: January 2024 graduate in Computer Science at the University of Victoria

work.name: Data Science Intern
highlights: developed tools for analyzing, predicting, and detecting customer churn, contributing to proactive measures for customer retention
explored and experimented with diverse machine learning techniques and models, including XGBoost Decision Trees, Linear Regression, Isolation Forests, and Median Absolute Deviation
consolidated and processed large datasets using normalization techniques to ensure data readiness for further analysis, optimizing insights and conclusions

work.name: Software Development Intern
highlights: developed a robust data collection sequence, analysis, and retention scripts in Python, leveraging multiple API calls and a SQL database for efficient data processing

orchestrated an agile development environment by seamlessly integrating AWS services, including S3 for storage, Lambda for server-less computing, EC2 for scalable computing power, and RDS for managed relational databases
applied pre-trained machine learning techniques to extract sentiment from text, enhancing insights for decision-making processes

courses: Operating Systems, Principles of Computer Science, Data Mining, Software System Scalability, Computer Networks, Computer Graphics, Database Systems, Software Development Methods, Calculus, Linear Algebra, Probability and Statistics

awards.title: NWHacks 2022 2nd Place
awards.summary: Developed SafetyNet along with two teamates. Awarded 2nd place. More about the project can be found under my projects
